name: Dirt Canal
uniques: Units ending their turn on this terrain take [50] damage <for [{Melee Water} {Ranged Water} {Submarine} {Aircraft Carrier}] units>

civilopediaText.text: For a long time, from the Zenu in South America to the Chinese, people have dug trenches to bend the water as they wish.

name: Concrete Canal
uniques: Units ending their turn on this terrain take [25] damage <for [{Melee Water} {Ranged Water} {Submarine} {Aircraft Carrier}] units>

civilopediaText.text: Technology and evolution do not spare anyone. Now we can have for once some canals that last longer.
Arguably the most important canal in our world, the trade between China and Europe cannot be stopped, not even by land, aparently.
One of the most impressive feats of engineering, elevating up to 26 meters high some of the biggest ships ever build, just to cross a tiny strip of land.
Cutting and making new water ways is the best way to increase trade efficency.
